patient_information: Age: 52 years Sex: male Comorbidities: ["type 2 diabetes mellitus", "poorly controlled hypertension"] Travel history: recent travel to Vietnam several years ago Last travel outside city: several years ago
history_of_present_illness: Timeline: 4 days of symptoms Key symptoms: ["fever", "headache", "malaise", "myalgia"] Severity pattern: apparent progression to severe disease with vascular leak and compensated shock
exposure_and_epidemiology: Place of residence travel: Vietnam Vector exposures: ["mosquito exposure implied by endemic setting"] Animal exposures: [] Water food risks: [] Contacts: [] Season outbreak context: Occupation:
vitals: Temperature: 36.5°C Blood pressure: 105/90 mmHg Heart rate: 120 bpm Respiratory rate: 28 breaths per minute Oxygen saturation: 93% on air
physical_exam: Mental status: drowsy, but rousable Gcs: 14/15 Temperature: 36.5°C Blood pressure: 105/90 mmHg Heart rate: 120 bpm Respiratory rate: 28 breaths per minute Oxygen saturation: 93% on air Peripheral oxygen saturation: 93% Radial pulse: weak Heart sounds: normal Abdominal distension: mild Shifting dullness: present Tender liver edge: 3 cm Liver size: mild hepatomegaly Gallbladder wall: thickened Skin exam: unremarkable
labs_and_diagnostics: Hemoglobin: 14.6 g/dL Haematocrit: 53.9% Platelets: 58 × 10^9/L Wcc: 2.1 × 10^9/L Neutrophils: 0.9 × 10^9/L Lymphocytes: 0.8 × 10^9/L C-reactive protein: 20 mg/L Urea: 7.8 mmol/L Creatinine: 114 μmol/L Alanine aminotransferase: 812 U/L Alkaline phosphatase: 260 U/L Total bilirubin: 18 μmol/L Lactate: 3.5 mmol/L
differential_diagnosis: Main alternatives: ["Dengue fever", "Chikungunya", "Malaria"] Reasons for consideration dengue: ["Short duration of symptoms before presentation", "Relatively low CRP and absence of neutrophil leucocytosis", "Clinical signs of shock: tachycardia, narrow pulse pressure (<20 mmHg), reduced GCS and raised serum lactate"] Reasons for consideration chikungunya: ["Epidemiology in South East Asia", "Possible sepsis"] Reasons for consideration malaria: ["No evidence of haemolysis to support this diagnosis", "Risk of malaria is very low in most urban areas of Vietnam"]
management_and_clinical_course: {'fluid_resuscitation': "Ringer's lactate solution at a volume of 10 mL/kg over 1 hour", 'rate_of_fluid_delivery': ['15 mL/kg/hr until sufficient haemodynamic improvement is shown', '7 mL/kg/hr for 2 hours and by a further 2 mL/kg/hr every 2 hours until no longer required'], 'clinical_assessments': 'haematocrit checks every 6 hours', 'discharge': '3 days later, after complete recovery'}
final_diagnosis: Disease name: Dengue fever Causative agent: Dengue virus Confirmation method: ["Detection of the NS1 antigen by RDTs or ELISA", "Detection of viral RNA using RT-PCR"] Evidence for alternatives ruled out: ["No evidence of haemolysis to support malaria diagnosis", "Risk of malaria is very low in most urban areas of Vietnam"]
